headshotImage.caption: MS Dhoni player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: MS Dhoni player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: MS Dhoni not out 92 (86b 7x4 4x6 144m) SR: 106.97
Ajinkya Rahane b Imran Tahir 51 (63b 6x4 0x6 94m) SR: 80.95

dismissalComment.html: he's bowled him round the legs! Tahir has taken off and Rahane can't believe it, he's still on the crease and is asking the umpires now. The umpires refer it to the third umpire. Rahane was sweeping the ball which pitched outside leg, but he misses and the ball turned just enough to clip the leg stump

headshotImage.caption: Axar Patel player page headshot cutout 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Axar Patel player page headshot cutout 2021

dismissalComment.html: loud appeal for lbw and Steyn pumps his fists as the finger goes up! Slightly back of length ball on leg stump, it was headed towards the leg stump as Axar tried to clip it to leg but was trapped on the back foot. Looks like it pitched right on the leg stump line, not outside, and Aleem Dar was the umpire not Kulkarni if you were wondering. Axar was a bit on his toes and the ball hit him just above the knee roll

headshotImage.caption: Harbhajan Singh player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Harbhajan Singh player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: short and extremely sweet from Harbhajan. Good cameo that, but Dhoni will have to farm the strike now. Full outside off, harbhajan swipes at that and gets a thick outside edge which flies to de Kock who clings onto a sharp chance to his right.

139 ks, and what a catch from de Kock. Only reflex. Yadav chooses a decent shot but doesn't execute well enough in a game of fine margins. Back of a length and Yadav looks to steer the ball to third man with the pace. But the ball goes too fine, de Kock dives to his right and takes a stunning catch. Excellently held.

soft dismissal. Loss in concentration there. Slower offcutter outside off, Dhawan just chips the ball to short cover. JP Duminy is surprised as he takes it. But that was a deceitful change in pace from Morkel. After all that pace, he goes slower and full which results in Dhawan going through the stroke much earlier

he's caught down the leg side, it was a short ball after all! Raina kept shuffling towards the off side, Morkel kept bowling them short and this time Raina was strangled down the leg side and even got a faint edge and QDK takes a good diving catch. The umpires check for a no ball and it's fine, Raina walks back

headshotImage.caption: Kagiso Rabada player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kagiso Rabada player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Rohit Sharma b Rabada 3 (10b 0x4 0x6 6m) SR: 30

dismissalComment.html: cleaned im up. What a strike. What an important strike that is. Too full and Rohit is slightly late on the flick. He is beaten for pace as the ball clips his pads and takes the off stump out. Huge wicket for SA.

dismissalText.commentary: Shikhar Dhawan c Duminy b Morkel 23 (34b 4x4 0x6 57m) SR: 67.64

dismissalComment.html: soft dismissal. Loss in concentration there. Slower offcutter outside off, Dhawan just chips the ball to short cover. JP Duminy is surprised as he takes it. But that was a deceitful change in pace from Morkel. After all that pace, he goes slower and full which results in Dhawan going through the stroke much earlier

dismissalText.commentary: Virat Kohli run out (Behardien/Steyn/†de Kock) 12 (18b 0x4 0x6 24m) SR: 66.66

dismissalComment.html: dropped at mid-off but there's a run out, what a horrible mix up, the two batsmen end up at non-striker's end! Kohli is out and he's absolutely livid! Rahane drove the ball down uppishly and in the air, Behardien leapt in the air and got both hands but it was a tough chance and it went down. The batsmen watch that and take one, then Kohli sprints back for the second while Rahane holds his hand up to say no but Kohli wants the run. Both are at the same end and the bails are taken off by the keeper. Kohli did make it on time and he was running to the danger end so looks like there was a run there

dismissalText.commentary: Ajinkya Rahane b Imran Tahir 51 (63b 6x4 0x6 94m) SR: 80.95

dismissalComment.html: he's bowled him round the legs! Tahir has taken off and Rahane can't believe it, he's still on the crease and is asking the umpires now. The umpires refer it to the third umpire. Rahane was sweeping the ball which pitched outside leg, but he misses and the ball turned just enough to clip the leg stump

dismissalText.commentary: Suresh Raina c †de Kock b Morkel 0 (5b 0x4 0x6 6m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: he's caught down the leg side, it was a short ball after all! Raina kept shuffling towards the off side, Morkel kept bowling them short and this time Raina was strangled down the leg side and even got a faint edge and QDK takes a good diving catch. The umpires check for a no ball and it's fine, Raina walks back

dismissalText.commentary: Axar Patel lbw b Steyn 13 (27b 0x4 1x6 20m) SR: 48.14

dismissalComment.html: loud appeal for lbw and Steyn pumps his fists as the finger goes up! Slightly back of length ball on leg stump, it was headed towards the leg stump as Axar tried to clip it to leg but was trapped on the back foot. Looks like it pitched right on the leg stump line, not outside, and Aleem Dar was the umpire not Kulkarni if you were wondering. Axar was a bit on his toes and the ball hit him just above the knee roll

dismissalText.commentary: Bhuvneshwar Kumar b Imran Tahir 14 (32b 1x4 0x6 42m) SR: 43.75

dismissalComment.html: and he has got him this time. Just a little slower through the air and Kumar looks to drive through long-off anticipating some legspin but this one doesn't spin. There is however, a huge gap between bat and pad and the delivery sneaks through and clips leg stump.

headshotImage.longCaption: Harbhajan Singh player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Harbhajan Singh player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Harbhajan Singh player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Harbhajan Singh c †de Kock b Steyn 22 (22b 2x4 1x6 33m) SR: 100

dismissalComment.html: short and extremely sweet from Harbhajan. Good cameo that, but Dhoni will have to farm the strike now. Full outside off, harbhajan swipes at that and gets a thick outside edge which flies to de Kock who clings onto a sharp chance to his right.

dismissalText.commentary: Umesh Yadav c †de Kock b Steyn 4 (3b 1x4 0x6 3m) SR: 133.33

dismissalComment.html: 139 ks, and what a catch from de Kock. Only reflex. Yadav chooses a decent shot but doesn't execute well enough in a game of fine margins. Back of a length and Yadav looks to steer the ball to third man with the pace. But the ball goes too fine, de Kock dives to his right and takes a stunning catch. Excellently held.

headshotImage.caption: Axar Patel player page headshot cutout 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Axar Patel player page headshot cutout 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Faf du Plessis c Kohli b Patel 51 (56b 6x4 0x6 70m) SR: 91.07

dismissalComment.html: this one goes straight to Kohli at cover. Great catch. Faf wanted to go over that man at cover but doesn't get under it enough. He hits it uppishly where Kohli jumps and holds onto a good catch. Massive wicket of the anchor

headshotImage.caption: Axar Patel player page headshot cutout 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Axar Patel player page headshot cutout 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Jean-Paul Duminy lbw b Patel 36 (46b 3x4 0x6 52m) SR: 78.26

dismissalComment.html: got im this time. Duminy gets down early and looks to hard sweep this but he misses and is struck on the pads. But was that outside the line? Not sure. Maybe not. Umpire Vineet Kulkarni is quick to raise his finger though. Struck him in front that. Good decision

headshotImage.caption: Axar Patel player page headshot cutout 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Axar Patel player page headshot cutout 2021

dismissalComment.html: he tries to whack him over the in field again and he's gone! The ball didn't come in with the angle after pitching outside off, Amla danced down and heaved but the ball turned a wee bit away and beat him completely. Dhoni takes the bails off so quickly in slow motion too

got im this time. Duminy gets down early and looks to hard sweep this but he misses and is struck on the pads. But was that outside the line? Not sure. Maybe not. Umpire Vineet Kulkarni is quick to raise his finger though. Struck him in front that. Good decision

this one goes straight to Kohli at cover. Great catch. Faf wanted to go over that man at cover but doesn't get under it enough. He hits it uppishly where Kohli jumps and holds onto a good catch. Massive wicket of the anchor

and Miller is gone! First delivery. Miller has to walk back. Another big wicket for India. Miller fishes at that and gets an edge through to Dhoni. First-ball duck. Excellent lines from Bhuvneshwar. Dhoni takes a good diving catch too. SA in trouble now.

outside edge this time, there was a sound and this time it goes to Dhoni, he leaps and throws the ball high! It wasn't too wide outside off, Tahir pushed at it without moving his feet and got a faint edge

edged again, taken with both hands by Raina at slip, India have won, Indore erupts! There was some room outside off and MM wanted to force it through the off side. He got a thick edge and Raina caught it over his head at slip

dismissalText.long: c MM Sharma b Harbhajan Singh
dismissalText.commentary: Quinton de Kock c MM Sharma b Harbhajan Singh 34 (36b 5x4 0x6 35m) SR: 94.44

dismissalComment.html: makes room and picks the fielder at long-off, Indore erupts! It was pitched up just outside off with some flight, he went towards leg and lofted it high and straight to Mohit for a simple catch which he had to come forward for

headshotImage.caption: Axar Patel player page headshot cutout 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Axar Patel player page headshot cutout 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Jean-Paul Duminy lbw b Patel 36 (46b 3x4 0x6 52m) SR: 78.26

dismissalComment.html: got im this time. Duminy gets down early and looks to hard sweep this but he misses and is struck on the pads. But was that outside the line? Not sure. Maybe not. Umpire Vineet Kulkarni is quick to raise his finger though. Struck him in front that. Good decision

headshotImage.longCaption: Axar Patel player page headshot cutout 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Faf du Plessis c Kohli b Patel 51 (56b 6x4 0x6 70m) SR: 91.07

dismissalComment.html: this one goes straight to Kohli at cover. Great catch. Faf wanted to go over that man at cover but doesn't get under it enough. He hits it uppishly where Kohli jumps and holds onto a good catch. Massive wicket of the anchor

headshotImage.caption: MS Dhoni player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: MS Dhoni player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: David Miller c †Dhoni b Kumar 0 (1b 0x4 0x6 3m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: and Miller is gone! First delivery. Miller has to walk back. Another big wicket for India. Miller fishes at that and gets an edge through to Dhoni. First-ball duck. Excellent lines from Bhuvneshwar. Dhoni takes a good diving catch too. SA in trouble now.

dismissalText.commentary: AB de Villiers c Kohli b MM Sharma 19 (20b 1x4 1x6 32m) SR: 95

dismissalComment.html: they have got the big man out. AB goes. Not a great shot, to be honest. Hits the ball in the air but too close to Kohli at cover. What a big wicket that is. Fuller length outside off, AB stays back and flat-bats the drive and Kohli dives low to his left and takes a good tumbling catch. Match-changing stuff from Virat.

dismissalText.commentary: Dale Steyn c Kohli b Yadav 13 (16b 1x4 1x6 18m) SR: 81.25

dismissalComment.html: gone, first ball. Poor shot from Steyn. Splice-jarring length from Yadav and Steyn looks to play that over cover, not the ball to play that shot to. It hits high on the bat and lobs up to Kohli at cover who takes a good running catch this time.

headshotImage.caption: Harbhajan Singh player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Harbhajan Singh player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: MS Dhoni player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: MS Dhoni player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Farhaan Behardien c †Dhoni b Harbhajan Singh 18 (33b 0x4 0x6 57m) SR: 54.54

dismissalComment.html: appeal for caught behind mainly from Dhoni, Vineet Kulkarni has given it after some time! Harbhajan did not appeal that hard after turning it down leg, not sure what the ball clipped on the way but Dhoni appealed and got the reward. no pad for sure. Replays and snicko show there was no bat either!

headshotImage.caption: MS Dhoni player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: MS Dhoni player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Imran Tahir c †Dhoni b Kumar 9 (12b 0x4 1x6 17m) SR: 75

dismissalComment.html: outside edge this time, there was a sound and this time it goes to Dhoni, he leaps and throws the ball high! It wasn't too wide outside off, Tahir pushed at it without moving his feet and got a faint edge

dismissalText.commentary: Morne Morkel c Raina b Kumar 4 (2b 1x4 0x6 1m) SR: 200

dismissalComment.html: edged again, taken with both hands by Raina at slip, India have won, Indore erupts! There was some room outside off and MM wanted to force it through the off side. He got a thick edge and Raina caught it over his head at slip

headshotImage.caption: MS Dhoni player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: MS Dhoni player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Axar Patel player page headshot cutout 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Axar Patel player page headshot cutout 2021

headshotImage.caption: MS Dhoni player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: MS Dhoni player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Morne Morkel c Raina b Kumar 4 (2b 1x4 0x6 1m) SR: 200

commentTextItems.html: edged again, taken with both hands by Raina at slip, India have won, Indore erupts! There was some room outside off and MM wanted to force it through the off side. He got a thick edge and Raina caught it over his head at slip

commentPostTextItems.html: De Villiers: They pulled it off across the line, credit to India. The target was manageable and a poor batting performance from us. We couldn't extend it after the opening partnership and we have the experience. You have to stay positive no matter what total you are chasing, we couldn't execute well. Very good performance from out bowlers, would have loved to chase something like 200. Nothing too serious about my back, just pulled my lower back a bit and should be fit for the next match.

Dhoni also the Man of the Match: Not an easy game played, a lot of people wait with open swords and want you to make mistakes. We should have got more with the bats and we didn't start well with our bowling but our spinners did well and pacers also came into action later on. Overall not a very convincing win but good win, we can play a lot better. We're not playing to our capacity, not even 80%, in batting or bowling. As a complete batting unit we didn't perform well but we bounced back well. We knew we needed two good deliveries when Tahir and Rabada were batting. I won't say the game was in our hands but we had a good chance if we bowled in the right areas and needed only two good deliveries. It doesn't always go your way (talking about his batting), the top order has been scoring loads of runs in the last 2-2.5 years so lower order doesn't get a big chance to bat. Apart from Suresh there's nobody who loves to do that kind of a job when you go out and you just have to go for the big hits. The pace was very important on this wicket and the length too. Axar is not a big turner of the ball and he pitched it in the right areas. Bhajji has the experience and they didn't try too many different things and flighting or under-flighting the ball was needed and overall they did a good job.

Phew! Dhoni spoke the way he batted a bit today, as if he was waiting to let out. That's all we have from the coverage of the second ODI. The series is level 1-1 and what more could you ask for. Do join us for the third match on the 18th, that's in Rajkot. Until then, goodbye and good luck from Vishal and Nikhil. Ciao!

8.45pm What a turnaround in the match from India! They were 124 for 6 at one point and an out of form Dhoni in the middle. He put together an unbeaten 92 and then the India bowlers, much criticised for not defending very well, bowl SA out for 225. Dhoni knew it had to be spin to put them in trouble and brought them on early on. The spinners not only took wickets but kept the pressure on...

Harbhajan: "Dhoni was fantastic with his captaincy. The wicket was nice to bat on and the ball was turning only when you bowled it slower. Here and there a few sixes went but we kept the pressure on and Axar took two crucial wickets. We felt we were 30 runs short and Dhoni said in the huddle that if we kept the energy up and saved 25-odd runs we could do it."
Baba Fasi: "I hope this will put Dhoni's critics to rest, at least for some time now.."
Nalsar: "SA gift the match to india. Poor decision by indian umpire!"
Ravi: "What a fantastic series this is turning out to be. Better for fans of cricket. "

commentPreTextItems.html: Only one wicket, and 27 runs...here's Morne Morkel

commentTextItems.html: just short of length and MM punches it down the ground, Dhawan dives to his left from mid-off but can't get to it. That's four!

dismissalText.commentary: Imran Tahir c †Dhoni b Kumar 9 (12b 0x4 1x6 17m) SR: 75

commentTextItems.html: outside edge this time, there was a sound and this time it goes to Dhoni, he leaps and throws the ball high! It wasn't too wide outside off, Tahir pushed at it without moving his feet and got a faint edge

commentPreTextItems.html: Under 30 to get now, this is getting tight with only two wickets. Harbhajan and Axar are done with their overs, so only pace left unless MSD goes back to Raina. Bhuvneshwar continues...

commentTextItems.html: Tahir tries to cut it outside off and gets an inside edge close to the stumps and it goes to Dhoni

commentPreTextItems.html: Nes: "Rabada only 20 years of age. What composure and the likely MoM. "

commentTextItems.html: on length on the stumps now, he defends it back easily

headshotImage.caption: Kagiso Rabada player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kagiso Rabada player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: too short on the leg side, Rabada pulls it late and gets some glove on that to send it fine on the leg side for four more!

commentPreTextItems.html: Mid off goes to wide long off

commentTextItems.html: length delivery around off and he turns it to mid-on. Tahir wants one but is sent back just in time
slightly short and wide outside off, Rabada takes a tiny step forward and slashes that over the covers and in the gap for four
on the pads from Umesh and it's tucked to midwicket
short of length outside off and Rabada swings and misses
not too wide outside off and the drive is mistimed a bit to find cover

headshotImage.caption: Kagiso Rabada player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kagiso Rabada player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: on the pads now and it's tucked away easily wide of midwicket for one
Tahir gets room outside off and he flays it off the back foot between point and cover point for one
shorter on middle and leg, tucked towards midwicket for a quick single
swings and misses this time with a drive outside off

commentPreTextItems.html: Bhuvneshwar to bowl now, he has three left and a slip

commentTextItems.html: just short of length but not much room, pushed to cover
some width outside off and it's pushed towards cover point

headshotImage.caption: Kagiso Rabada player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kagiso Rabada player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Harbhajan Singh player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Harbhajan Singh player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: Tahir sees room and drives without moving his feet, and misses
length delivery on off, pushed into the covers

short of length outside off, pushed into the covers and there's a fumble from a sliding Rohit and he concedes a single. I think Kohli threw the ball to non-striker's end after that and missed the stumps. Rabada jumped over the ball despite crossing the crease, but had the ball hit the stumps, he was out!

headshotImage.longCaption: Harbhajan Singh player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: short and extremely sweet from Harbhajan. Good cameo that, but Dhoni will have to farm the strike now. Full outside off, harbhajan swipes at that and gets a thick outside edge which flies to de Kock who clings onto a sharp chance to his right.

139 ks, and what a catch from de Kock. Only reflex. Yadav chooses a decent shot but doesn't execute well enough in a game of fine margins. Back of a length and Yadav looks to steer the ball to third man with the pace. But the ball goes too fine, de Kock dives to his right and takes a stunning catch. Excellently held.

headshotImage.caption: Kagiso Rabada player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kagiso Rabada player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: cleaned im up. What a strike. What an important strike that is. Too full and Rohit is slightly late on the flick. He is beaten for pace as the ball clips his pads and takes the off stump out. Huge wicket for SA.

soft dismissal. Loss in concentration there. Slower offcutter outside off, Dhawan just chips the ball to short cover. JP Duminy is surprised as he takes it. But that was a deceitful change in pace from Morkel. After all that pace, he goes slower and full which results in Dhawan going through the stroke much earlier

he's caught down the leg side, it was a short ball after all! Raina kept shuffling towards the off side, Morkel kept bowling them short and this time Raina was strangled down the leg side and even got a faint edge and QDK takes a good diving catch. The umpires check for a no ball and it's fine, Raina walks back

he's bowled him round the legs! Tahir has taken off and Rahane can't believe it, he's still on the crease and is asking the umpires now. The umpires refer it to the third umpire. Rahane was sweeping the ball which pitched outside leg, but he misses and the ball turned just enough to clip the leg stump

and he has got him this time. Just a little slower through the air and Kumar looks to drive through long-off anticipating some legspin but this one doesn't spin. There is however, a huge gap between bat and pad and the delivery sneaks through and clips leg stump.

headshotImage.longCaption: MS Dhoni player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: MS Dhoni player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: MS Dhoni player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Kagiso Rabada player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kagiso Rabada player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Rohit Sharma b Rabada 3 (10b 0x4 0x6 6m) SR: 30

dismissalComment.html: cleaned im up. What a strike. What an important strike that is. Too full and Rohit is slightly late on the flick. He is beaten for pace as the ball clips his pads and takes the off stump out. Huge wicket for SA.

dismissalText.commentary: Shikhar Dhawan c Duminy b Morkel 23 (34b 4x4 0x6 57m) SR: 67.64

dismissalComment.html: soft dismissal. Loss in concentration there. Slower offcutter outside off, Dhawan just chips the ball to short cover. JP Duminy is surprised as he takes it. But that was a deceitful change in pace from Morkel. After all that pace, he goes slower and full which results in Dhawan going through the stroke much earlier

dismissalText.commentary: Virat Kohli run out (Behardien/Steyn/†de Kock) 12 (18b 0x4 0x6 24m) SR: 66.66

dismissalComment.html: dropped at mid-off but there's a run out, what a horrible mix up, the two batsmen end up at non-striker's end! Kohli is out and he's absolutely livid! Rahane drove the ball down uppishly and in the air, Behardien leapt in the air and got both hands but it was a tough chance and it went down. The batsmen watch that and take one, then Kohli sprints back for the second while Rahane holds his hand up to say no but Kohli wants the run. Both are at the same end and the bails are taken off by the keeper. Kohli did make it on time and he was running to the danger end so looks like there was a run there

dismissalText.commentary: Ajinkya Rahane b Imran Tahir 51 (63b 6x4 0x6 94m) SR: 80.95

dismissalComment.html: he's bowled him round the legs! Tahir has taken off and Rahane can't believe it, he's still on the crease and is asking the umpires now. The umpires refer it to the third umpire. Rahane was sweeping the ball which pitched outside leg, but he misses and the ball turned just enough to clip the leg stump

dismissalText.commentary: Suresh Raina c †de Kock b Morkel 0 (5b 0x4 0x6 6m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: he's caught down the leg side, it was a short ball after all! Raina kept shuffling towards the off side, Morkel kept bowling them short and this time Raina was strangled down the leg side and even got a faint edge and QDK takes a good diving catch. The umpires check for a no ball and it's fine, Raina walks back

headshotImage.caption: Axar Patel player page headshot cutout 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Axar Patel player page headshot cutout 2021

headshotImage.caption: Axar Patel player page headshot cutout 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Axar Patel player page headshot cutout 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Axar Patel lbw b Steyn 13 (27b 0x4 1x6 20m) SR: 48.14

dismissalComment.html: loud appeal for lbw and Steyn pumps his fists as the finger goes up! Slightly back of length ball on leg stump, it was headed towards the leg stump as Axar tried to clip it to leg but was trapped on the back foot. Looks like it pitched right on the leg stump line, not outside, and Aleem Dar was the umpire not Kulkarni if you were wondering. Axar was a bit on his toes and the ball hit him just above the knee roll

dismissalText.commentary: Bhuvneshwar Kumar b Imran Tahir 14 (32b 1x4 0x6 42m) SR: 43.75

dismissalComment.html: and he has got him this time. Just a little slower through the air and Kumar looks to drive through long-off anticipating some legspin but this one doesn't spin. There is however, a huge gap between bat and pad and the delivery sneaks through and clips leg stump.

headshotImage.caption: Harbhajan Singh player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Harbhajan Singh player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Harbhajan Singh player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Harbhajan Singh player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Harbhajan Singh c †de Kock b Steyn 22 (22b 2x4 1x6 33m) SR: 100

dismissalComment.html: short and extremely sweet from Harbhajan. Good cameo that, but Dhoni will have to farm the strike now. Full outside off, harbhajan swipes at that and gets a thick outside edge which flies to de Kock who clings onto a sharp chance to his right.

dismissalText.commentary: Umesh Yadav c †de Kock b Steyn 4 (3b 1x4 0x6 3m) SR: 133.33

dismissalComment.html: 139 ks, and what a catch from de Kock. Only reflex. Yadav chooses a decent shot but doesn't execute well enough in a game of fine margins. Back of a length and Yadav looks to steer the ball to third man with the pace. But the ball goes too fine, de Kock dives to his right and takes a stunning catch. Excellently held.

headshotImage.caption: Axar Patel player page headshot cutout 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Axar Patel player page headshot cutout 2021

headshotImage.caption: MS Dhoni player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: MS Dhoni player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Hashim Amla st †Dhoni b Patel 17 (17b 3x4 0x6 25m) SR: 100

dismissalComment.html: he tries to whack him over the in field again and he's gone! The ball didn't come in with the angle after pitching outside off, Amla danced down and heaved but the ball turned a wee bit away and beat him completely. Dhoni takes the bails off so quickly in slow motion too

headshotImage.caption: Harbhajan Singh player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Harbhajan Singh player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.long: c MM Sharma b Harbhajan Singh
dismissalText.commentary: Quinton de Kock c MM Sharma b Harbhajan Singh 34 (36b 5x4 0x6 35m) SR: 94.44

dismissalComment.html: makes room and picks the fielder at long-off, Indore erupts! It was pitched up just outside off with some flight, he went towards leg and lofted it high and straight to Mohit for a simple catch which he had to come forward for

headshotImage.caption: Axar Patel player page headshot cutout 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Axar Patel player page headshot cutout 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Faf du Plessis c Kohli b Patel 51 (56b 6x4 0x6 70m) SR: 91.07

dismissalComment.html: this one goes straight to Kohli at cover. Great catch. Faf wanted to go over that man at cover but doesn't get under it enough. He hits it uppishly where Kohli jumps and holds onto a good catch. Massive wicket of the anchor

headshotImage.caption: Axar Patel player page headshot cutout 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Axar Patel player page headshot cutout 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Jean-Paul Duminy lbw b Patel 36 (46b 3x4 0x6 52m) SR: 78.26

dismissalComment.html: got im this time. Duminy gets down early and looks to hard sweep this but he misses and is struck on the pads. But was that outside the line? Not sure. Maybe not. Umpire Vineet Kulkarni is quick to raise his finger though. Struck him in front that. Good decision

dismissalText.commentary: AB de Villiers c Kohli b MM Sharma 19 (20b 1x4 1x6 32m) SR: 95

dismissalComment.html: they have got the big man out. AB goes. Not a great shot, to be honest. Hits the ball in the air but too close to Kohli at cover. What a big wicket that is. Fuller length outside off, AB stays back and flat-bats the drive and Kohli dives low to his left and takes a good tumbling catch. Match-changing stuff from Virat.

headshotImage.caption: MS Dhoni player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: MS Dhoni player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: David Miller c †Dhoni b Kumar 0 (1b 0x4 0x6 3m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: and Miller is gone! First delivery. Miller has to walk back. Another big wicket for India. Miller fishes at that and gets an edge through to Dhoni. First-ball duck. Excellent lines from Bhuvneshwar. Dhoni takes a good diving catch too. SA in trouble now.

headshotImage.caption: Harbhajan Singh player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Harbhajan Singh player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: MS Dhoni player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: MS Dhoni player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Farhaan Behardien c †Dhoni b Harbhajan Singh 18 (33b 0x4 0x6 57m) SR: 54.54

dismissalComment.html: appeal for caught behind mainly from Dhoni, Vineet Kulkarni has given it after some time! Harbhajan did not appeal that hard after turning it down leg, not sure what the ball clipped on the way but Dhoni appealed and got the reward. no pad for sure. Replays and snicko show there was no bat either!

dismissalText.commentary: Dale Steyn c Kohli b Yadav 13 (16b 1x4 1x6 18m) SR: 81.25

dismissalComment.html: gone, first ball. Poor shot from Steyn. Splice-jarring length from Yadav and Steyn looks to play that over cover, not the ball to play that shot to. It hits high on the bat and lobs up to Kohli at cover who takes a good running catch this time.

headshotImage.caption: Kagiso Rabada player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kagiso Rabada player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Kagiso Rabada not out 19 (23b 3x4 0x6 37m) SR: 82.6

headshotImage.caption: MS Dhoni player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: MS Dhoni player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Imran Tahir c †Dhoni b Kumar 9 (12b 0x4 1x6 17m) SR: 75

dismissalComment.html: outside edge this time, there was a sound and this time it goes to Dhoni, he leaps and throws the ball high! It wasn't too wide outside off, Tahir pushed at it without moving his feet and got a faint edge

dismissalText.commentary: Morne Morkel c Raina b Kumar 4 (2b 1x4 0x6 1m) SR: 200

dismissalComment.html: edged again, taken with both hands by Raina at slip, India have won, Indore erupts! There was some room outside off and MM wanted to force it through the off side. He got a thick edge and Raina caught it over his head at slip

and Miller is gone! First delivery. Miller has to walk back. Another big wicket for India. Miller fishes at that and gets an edge through to Dhoni. First-ball duck. Excellent lines from Bhuvneshwar. Dhoni takes a good diving catch too. SA in trouble now.

notes: India innings
Powerplay 1: Overs 0.1 - 10.0 (Mandatory - 44 runs, 1 wicket)
Powerplay 2: Overs 10.1 - 40.0 (Mandatory - 121 runs, 6 wickets)
India: 50 runs in 11.1 overs (67 balls), Extras 3
2nd Wicket: 50 runs in 58 balls (S Dhawan 21, AM Rahane 26, Ex 3)
Drinks: India - 71/2 in 16.0 overs (AM Rahane 35, V Kohli 7)
India: 100 runs in 21.4 overs (130 balls), Extras 3
AM Rahane: 50 off 59 balls (6 x 4)
Drinks: India - 132/6 in 32.0 overs (MS Dhoni 24, B Kumar 0)
India: 150 runs in 36.5 overs (221 balls), Extras 7
Powerplay 3: Overs 40.1 - 50.0 (Mandatory - 82 runs, 2 wickets)
MS Dhoni: 50 off 57 balls (3 x 4, 2 x 6)
India: 200 runs in 44.2 overs (267 balls), Extras 10
8th Wicket: 50 runs in 37 balls (MS Dhoni 31, Harbhajan Singh 17, Ex 2)
Innings Break: India - 247/9 in 50.0 overs (MS Dhoni 92, MM Sharma 0)
South Africa innings
Powerplay 1: Overs 0.1 - 10.0 (Mandatory - 56 runs, 2 wickets)
South Africa: 50 runs in 9.1 overs (55 balls), Extras 0
Powerplay 2: Overs 10.1 - 40.0 (Mandatory - 152 runs, 6 wickets)
South Africa: 100 runs in 19.5 overs (119 balls), Extras 1
3rd Wicket: 50 runs in 62 balls (F du Plessis 26, JP Duminy 24, Ex 1)
Drinks: South Africa - 103/2 in 20.0 overs (F du Plessis 27, JP Duminy 24)
F du Plessis: 50 off 51 balls (6 x 4)
South Africa: 150 runs in 29.3 overs (177 balls), Extras 2
Drinks: South Africa - 186/7 in 36.1 overs (F Behardien 12)
South Africa: 200 runs in 39.2 overs (236 balls), Extras 4

milestones.description: Hashim Amla has scored 21 hundreds in ODIs, the most for SA breaking de Villiers's record

stories.title: India v South Africa, 2015-16
stories.subTitle: 2nd ODI, Indore
stories.seoTitle: Wisden Almanack review: India v South Africa 2015-16
stories.summary: Wisden's review of the second ODI, India v South Africa, 2015-16

stories.title: 'Can't put too much pressure on youngsters' - Dhoni
stories.subTitle: India v South Africa, 2nd ODI, Indore
stories.seoTitle: 'Can't put too much pressure on youngsters' - Dhoni
stories.summary: MS Dhoni had intended to bat at No.4 in the ODI side after his Test retirement, but he decided to stay at No.5 to help the development of the junior players. His finishing ability was again on show in India's win in Indore.

image.caption: MS Dhoni unleashes a powerful pull
image.longCaption: MS Dhoni unleashes a powerful pull, India v South Africa, 2nd ODI, Indore, October 14, 2015

stories.title: Calm Dhoni towers above the chaos
stories.subTitle: India v SA, 2nd ODI, Indore
stories.seoTitle: Calm Dhoni towers above the chaos
stories.summary: After a difficult week in which his very place in the team was being questioned, he answered back with an innings of hope, skill and defiance

image.caption: MS Dhoni launched four sixes in his 92
image.longCaption: MS Dhoni launched four sixes in his 92, India v South Africa, 2nd ODI, Indore, October 14, 2015

stories.title: De Villiers pulls up top order for failed chase
stories.subTitle: India v South Africa, 2nd ODI, Indore
stories.seoTitle: De Villiers pulls up top order for failed chase
stories.summary: AB de Villiers has pulled up South Africa's seven specialist batsmen for their failure to finish off the second ODI in Indore after their bowlers gave them an early advantage

image.caption: A disappointed AB de Villiers walks back
image.longCaption: A disappointed AB de Villiers walks back, India v South Africa, 2nd ODI, Indore, October 14, 2015

stories.subTitle: India v South Africa, 2nd ODI, Indore
stories.summary: Plays of the day from the second ODI between India and South Africa in Indore

image.caption: MS Dhoni unleashes a powerful pull
image.longCaption: MS Dhoni unleashes a powerful pull, India v South Africa, 2nd ODI, Indore, October 14, 2015

stories.title: Dhoni 20, Kohli 20
stories.subTitle: India v South Africa, 2nd ODI, Indore
stories.summary: Statistical highlights from India's 22-run win over South Africa in the second ODI in Indore

image.caption: MS Dhoni launched four sixes in his 92
image.longCaption: MS Dhoni launched four sixes in his 92, India v South Africa, 2nd ODI, Indore, October 14, 2015

stories.title: All-round bowling effort gives India win
stories.subTitle: India v South Africa, 2nd ODI, Indore
stories.seoTitle: All-round bowling effort gives India win

image.caption: Harbhajan Singh bowled a tidy first spell
image.longCaption: Harbhajan Singh bowled a tidy first spell, India v South Africa, 2nd ODI, Indore, October 14, 2015

stories.title: Dhoni, spinners lift India to 22-run win
stories.subTitle: India v South Africa, 2nd ODI, Indore
stories.seoTitle: Dhoni, spinners lift India to 22-run win
stories.summary: South Africa's batsmen could not pull off a successful chase of what seemed to be a below-par target as India, led by their spinners and MS Dhoni, leveled the series with a 22-run win and maintained their 100% record at the Holkar Stadium in Indore

image.caption: MS Dhoni unleashes a powerful pull
image.longCaption: MS Dhoni unleashes a powerful pull, India v South Africa, 2nd ODI, Indore, October 14, 2015

stories.title: Rahane and the No. 3 jigsaw puzzle
stories.subTitle: India v South Africa, 2nd ODI, Indore
stories.seoTitle: Ajinkya Rahane and the No. 3 jigsaw puzzle
stories.summary: Ajinkya Rahane is well equipped at No. 3 to play the role Kane Williamson does for New Zealand, but with Virat Kohli having established himself in that position the team management has a tightrope to walk

image.caption: Ajinkya Rahane executes a fine sweep
image.longCaption: Ajinkya Rahane executes a fine sweep, India v South Africa, 1st ODI, Kanpur, October 11, 2015

stories.title: India under pressure to regain lost ground
stories.subTitle: India v South Africa, 2nd ODI, Indore
stories.seoTitle: India under pressure to regain lost ground
stories.summary: The South African visit threatens to very quickly go downhill for India after they lost the T20 series and the first ODI. They have also lost their premier spinner, R Ashwin, to a side strain and need to quickly get things back on track

image.caption: Stuart Binny flays one through the off side
image.longCaption: Stuart Binny flays one through the off side, Zimbabwe v India, 1st T20, Harare, July 17, 2015

stories.title: SA working on staying in the moment - Langeveldt
stories.subTitle: India v South Africa, 2nd ODI, Indore
stories.seoTitle: SA working on staying in the moment - Langeveldt
stories.summary: South Africa's bowling coach Charl Langeveldt has said the team is working on developing their situational awareness and "staying in the moment"

image.caption: Charl Langeveldt at a training session
image.longCaption: Charl Langeveldt at a training session, Abu Dhabi, October  28, 2010

videos.title: 'Loss is on the batsmen's shoulders' - de Villiers
videos.subTitle: INDIA V SA, 2ND ODI, INDORE
videos.seoTitle: 'Loss is on the batsmen's shoulders' - de Villiers
videos.summary: South Africa captain AB de Villiers says that the side's batsmen, particularly the top seven, should take responsibility for the 22-run loss to India in Indore, where they failed to chase down 248

videos.title: Agarkar: SA will be gutted to have given India a real gift
videos.subTitle: India v South Africa, 2nd ODI, Indore
videos.seoTitle: Agarkar: SA will be gutted to have given India a real gift
videos.summary: Ajit Agarkar says that South Africa will be deeply disappointed by the batting performance that cost them the second ODI against India in Indore

videos.title: Was focused on building a partnership - Dhoni
videos.subTitle: India v South Africa, 2nd ODI, Kanpur
videos.seoTitle: Was focused on building a partnership - Dhoni
videos.summary: MS Dhoni talks about his  unbeaten knock of 92 and how India were hurt by the lack of partnerships while batting in their 22-run win over South Africa, in Indore

videos.title: By The Numbers - Virat's lean patch, and Axar's best
videos.subTitle: India v South Africa, 2nd ODI, Indore
videos.seoTitle: By The Numbers - Virat's lean patch, and Axar's best
videos.summary: Statistical highlights of India's 22-run win over South Africa in the second ODI at the Holkar Stadium in Indore

videos.title: 'Rahane compliments me well' - Rohit
videos.subTitle: INDIA V SA, 2ND ODI, INDORE
videos.summary: India opening batsman Rohit Sharma on teammate Ajinkya Rahane's appointment to no. 3 in the batting order

videos.title: Langeveldt urges South Africa to compete
videos.subTitle: INDIA V SA, 2ND ODI, INDORE
videos.seoTitle: Langeveldt urges South Africa to compete
videos.summary: South Africa bowling coach Charl Langeveldt has been telling his players that no matter the situation they can bounce back and win if they stay focused

videos.title: Agarkar: India's biggest worry would be Ashwin's fitness
videos.subTitle: India v South Africa, 2nd ODI, Indore
videos.seoTitle: Agarkar: India's biggest worry would be Ashwin's fitness
videos.summary: Ajit Agarkar believes despite losing a close game, India will be more worried about R Ashwin's injury and would want more runs from Virat Kohli in the second ODI against South Africa

stories.summary: Wisden's review of the second ODI, India v South Africa, 2015-16

stories.title: 'Can't put too much pressure on youngsters' - Dhoni
stories.subTitle: India v South Africa, 2nd ODI, Indore
stories.seoTitle: 'Can't put too much pressure on youngsters' - Dhoni
stories.summary: MS Dhoni had intended to bat at No.4 in the ODI side after his Test retirement, but he decided to stay at No.5 to help the development of the junior players. His finishing ability was again on show in India's win in Indore.

image.caption: MS Dhoni unleashes a powerful pull
image.longCaption: MS Dhoni unleashes a powerful pull, India v South Africa, 2nd ODI, Indore, October 14, 2015

stories.title: Calm Dhoni towers above the chaos
stories.subTitle: India v SA, 2nd ODI, Indore
stories.seoTitle: Calm Dhoni towers above the chaos
stories.summary: After a difficult week in which his very place in the team was being questioned, he answered back with an innings of hope, skill and defiance

image.caption: MS Dhoni launched four sixes in his 92
image.longCaption: MS Dhoni launched four sixes in his 92, India v South Africa, 2nd ODI, Indore, October 14, 2015

stories.seoTitle: De Villiers pulls up top order for failed chase
stories.summary: AB de Villiers has pulled up South Africa's seven specialist batsmen for their failure to finish off the second ODI in Indore after their bowlers gave them an early advantage

recentReportStory.title: Dhoni, spinners lift India to 22-run win
recentReportStory.subTitle: India v South Africa, 2nd ODI, Indore
recentReportStory.seoTitle: Dhoni, spinners lift India to 22-run win
recentReportStory.summary: South Africa's batsmen could not pull off a successful chase of what seemed to be a below-par target as India, led by their spinners and MS Dhoni, leveled the series with a 22-run win and maintained their 100% record at the Holkar Stadium in Indore

image.caption: MS Dhoni unleashes a powerful pull
image.longCaption: MS Dhoni unleashes a powerful pull, India v South Africa, 2nd ODI, Indore, October 14, 2015

recentReportStory.credit: Firdose Moonda is ESPNcricinfo's South Africa correspondent
